title: Plate, ""Corsica"", mid-19th century
markings: printed on underside: neoclassical urn flanked by flowers atop base with "Corsica" printed across it. Beneath looped rope motif in which "W&C" are printed with in open reserves.
description: Scalloped-edge plate with green transfer-printed decoration on white ground. Central scene depicting Renaissance couple surrounded by classical architectural structures, columns, urns and mountainous landscape. Border of four alternating cartouches, two with architectural motifs, two with baskets of blooming flowers; between each reserve are dense patterns with alternating decorative motifs. Condition note: small chip on border.

exhibitions.title: Multiple Choice: From Sample to Product

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, ""Corsica"", mid-19th century.
mid-19th century. Earthenware, transfer-printed decoration. Gift of Paul F. Walter. 2001-25-2.
